Key Match Events: Donovan Mitchell scored 30 points including a jumper with three-tenths of a second left to secure the win for the Cleveland Cavaliers.
Damian Lillard had a brilliant performance with 41 points, nine assists, and shot 10 of 15 from 3-point range.
Giannis Antetokounmpo contributed 34 points, 16 rebounds, and nine assists for the Bucks.
Lillard put Milwaukee ahead with a step-back jumper with 9.8 seconds remaining.
Mitchell regained possession after briefly losing control and hit a 19-footer to win the game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cleveland Cavaliers are one win away from matching their best start in franchise history, having won their first eight games in 1976-77.
Milwaukee Bucks have lost five straight games since winning their opener.
The Bucks played without Khris Middleton, who is recovering from surgery on his ankles.
